author: andrewgoodwall
title: The Future of Cardano is African
description: Youth across various African countries are unaware of Cardano and the entrepreneurship opportunities that exist.

f6_assessments.q0: The main objective of the proposal is to promote content about Cardano and about blockchain in general through a teaching platform. We have here that the main differential, in addition to the creation of quality content, is in this platform. Instead of spending and planning in relation to logistics and infrastructure, it is possible to be primarily concerned with the quality of the content being produced and the engagement of the public around it, as there is a whole network already validated by millions of users. With that, we have that this proposal fits the challenge in question, since this content will be produced with a focus on Africa and will be available in languages ​​that are widely spoken nationally. Furthermore, with a good performance of the project, it is expected that more people from the continent will show interest in participating in the ecosystem, including contributing with business ideas. Certainly the project has a good chance of having a positive impact on Cardano's visibility, in addition to being naturally scalable. About the budget being requested of $37,500 we see that it is higher than in other similar proposals aimed at education, but this is justified due to the structure of the platform and the team involved.
f6_assessments.q1:
Due to the characteristics described above, we expect considerable organization in the feasibility plan. And you can see that this is confirmed. The steps chosen and described in the plan go far beyond the production of educational materials alone. Several techniques are considered to generate considerable engagement in the process, among which we can mention with special attention the diversity of formats in which the materials will be produced, including the participation of local influencers. It is also interesting to see the separation of the process actions into three main stages, starting with the production of materials and even considering at the end an analysis of the results. Another feature that makes us strongly believe in the feasibility of the process is the maintenance of videos on the platform after production. As in most businesses, we know that there is a seasonality of interest in certain subjects. That way, whenever the subject of blockchain is hot, people from the continent will be able to find educational videos on GoodWall.

Regarding the budget details, we found a good distribution of capital among several fronts such as project design, structuring, dissemination and even awards. In particular, we can mention that a considerable part of the funding ($7,108) will be devoted to dissemination, which makes a lot of sense given the magnitude of the target audience to be reached. Regarding the team of professionals involved in the project, we observed that the team's experience with marketing, dissemination and project management is impressive, showing that they seem to be the ideal team to carry out the project. Additionally, additional information from these professionals can still be found at the address provided in the proposal (https://www.goodwall.io/about).
f6_assessments.q2:
In line with the entire structuring of the proposal so far, we also found very consistent information both on ways to measure the project's progress and on the perception of success. It is even interesting to see how these two pieces of information are related in this section. For example, impression and engagement were two concepts chosen to measure the progress of the proposal. And when explaining the success, the team quantified these ideas into well-defined numerical goals; 1 million impressions and 30,000 engagements as milestones to reach.

Other information relevant to the auditability of the project can actually be found even earlier, when we see the team's concern to carry out an analysis of results and a survey in the final weeks of the project.

The proposal provides evidence of relevant skills and experience of each team member needed to execute this project. A team of 7 is been proposed for the realization of the proposal with a brief description of each member's field experience and a resourceful link. However, I think the membership of the team should be increased to include Finance Consultants, Lawyers, Assembly of Inspired Masses and Language Specialists to make the team more solid. Budgetary allocations have been outlined clearly and segregated into identifiable items and is reasonable . The team has put a strong plan and timetable for delivering the solution under three stages but I did not see a strategy to handle language barriers hence my opinion for the team to include the services of Language Specialist comes into play.

f6_assessments.q0:
The program's goal is to raise awareness of blockchain technology in Africa, which is very much in accordance with the challenge's requirement. 

It denotes expertise in the topic of education in other areas as they already have an infrastructure in place and are not creating it from scratch.

The program is focused on the usage of blockchain in general, so it is certainly important for Cardano, but I would want the subjects to be much more focused on how to utilize it in the Cardano ecosystem, because the description leads me to believe it is quite generic.

Even though the younger generations have easy access to technology, it is undeniable that schools and institutions do not have preparations in place to teach blockchain-related issues, as a result, the impact of such a project is critical.

f6_assessments.q0: This entity is a new great addition to the Cardano community, what they bring into Cardano is a vast network of students, scholarships, workshops and potential employment opportunities. One only need to download their app to see their extent of their network. A unique achievement of this app is their endeavor into the Africa prior to joining Cardano. In conjunction with UNICEF, Goodwall became the platform where the youth of Ghana shared and brainstormed ideas on various topics. There ideas where then met by UNICEF who by working together found ways to materialize those ideas. Around 2000+ ideas came from this collaboration. Now they want to replicate and expand this idea together with Cardano. As Goodwall slowly introduces themselves into Cardano, it is highly likely numerous potential collaboration can be spawn from this union. At the very least, a joint program with UNICEF together with Goodwall to continue to build their work in Ghana. Or even a collaboration between Goodwall and WADA. It's only matter of time till beautiful collaborations will happen, especially since the introduction of Goodwall into Cardano was helped by Yoram. A collaborator in numerous Cardano communities and also involved in the develop of Cardano in Africa.
f6_assessments.q1:
This proposal is basically a continuation of their joint program with UNICEF in Ghana. What differs is what knowledge will be available. In this case it will be about education on Cardano in Africa, both in French and English. What is crucial to be stated in their proposal is to build relationships with the existing Cardano community. For the key word to grow in Cardano, is community. That is something that Goodwall corporate culture might not be used to. Although that most likely will not be an issue for their core values are on building together with the community. This collaboration spirit key point, fortunately was stated early on their proposal.

Their timeline action plan though unfortunately does not mirror this. There is inklings of a collaborative spirit here and there but not consciously stated in their action plan. Although it is clearly stated in their budget. A bit disjointed in their writing, but seeing that there is a specific budget to communicate and build relationships with the community, I am sure this is purely a writing issue.

Just wish their budget although encompasses their grand view, it would have been nice to have glimpse here and there of what specifically they are trying do. Most importantly their program design. What program will be created? With who will they collaborate? Seeing that their new to Cardano, perhaps both action plan and budget would be more focus on community collaboration, but in how they write it up, it seems to not be the case. Again I believe this is just a writing issue.
f6_assessments.q2: They indeed have provided to us a document that portrays their standard in reporting, which is comprehensive, visually easy to understand and to an extent we can imagine quite transparent. Why quite transparent? Because their metrics come from the date retrieved from their app. A strength and a weakness. Seeing that the culture of Cardano is majority open-source, perhaps some might find centralized report to be bothering. Some might feel the numbers can be tampered. Since it is a cultural thing, perhaps in the future, Goodwall could consider a decentralized system in reporting. Perhaps through the use of GitHub. Beside that, everything else looks great, they even have mentioned will provide a Google drive for all their documentation and recorded information.

The roadmap provided is detailed and there are also comprehensive milestones and time horizon. 
The metrics/KPIs are very clear as we can tell the number of impressions, engagements and challenge entries that are expected to be realized, and they are good indicators of the desired outcome. The described problem here is clear, and the solution provided is good to tackle the problem.

solution: Educate youth on the basics of blockchain, its applications, and social impact possibilities, via experiential learning programs on Goodwall
experience: Goodwall is a mobile-first platform with 2M+ members across 150+ countries, guiding youth aged 16-24 through the world of education and work. Goodwall has hosted a number of wide-scale programs and challenges on the platform, with a recent program reaching 4.2M+ youth in Ghana.
